speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: SCENE VI. The same. A banqueting-room in Timon's house.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Music. Tables set out: Servants attending.  Enter divers Lords, Senators and others, at several doors

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: The good time of day to you, sir.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: I also wish it to you. I think this honourable lord

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: did but try us this other day.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Upon that were my thoughts tiring, when we

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: encountered: I hope it is not so low with him as

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: he made it seem in the trial of his several friends.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: It should not be, by the persuasion of his new feasting.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: I should think so: he hath sent me an earnest

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: inviting, which many my near occasions did urge me

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: to put off; but he hath conjured me beyond them, and

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: I must needs appear.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: In like manner was I in debt to my importunate

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: business, but he would not hear my excuse. I am

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: sorry, when he sent to borrow of me, that my

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: provision was out.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: I am sick of that grief too, as I understand how all

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: things go.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Every man here's so. What would he have borrowed of

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: you?

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: A thousand pieces.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: A thousand pieces!

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: What of you?

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: He sent to me, sir,--Here he comes.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Enter TIMON and Attendants

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: With all my heart, gentlemen both; and how fare you?

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Ever at the best, hearing well of your lordship.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: The swallow follows not summer more willing than we

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: your lordship.

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: [Aside]  Nor more willingly leaves winter; such

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: summer-birds are men. Gentlemen, our dinner will not

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: recompense this long stay: feast your ears with the

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: music awhile, if they will fare so harshly o' the

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: trumpet's sound; we shall to 't presently.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: I hope it remains not unkindly with your lordship

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: that I returned you an empty messenger.

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: O, sir, let it not trouble you.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: My noble lord,--

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Ah, my good friend, what cheer?

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: My most honourable lord, I am e'en sick of shame,

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: that, when your lordship this other day sent to me,

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: I was so unfortunate a beggar.

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Think not on 't, sir.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: If you had sent but two hours before,--

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Let it not cumber your better remembrance.

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: The banquet brought in

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Come, bring in all together.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: All covered dishes!

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Royal cheer, I warrant you.

speaker: Third Lord
text_entry: Doubt not that, if money and the season can yield

speaker: Third Lord
text_entry: it.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: How do you? What's the news?

speaker: Third Lord
text_entry: Alcibiades is banished: hear you of it?

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Alcibiades banished!

speaker: Third Lord
text_entry: 'Tis so, be sure of it.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: How! how!

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: I pray you, upon what?

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: My worthy friends, will you draw near?

speaker: Third Lord
text_entry: I'll tell you more anon. Here's a noble feast toward.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: This is the old man still.

speaker: Third Lord
text_entry: Will 't hold? will 't hold?

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: It does: but time will--and so--

speaker: Third Lord
text_entry: I do conceive.

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Each man to his stool, with that spur as he would to

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: the lip of his mistress: your diet shall be in all

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: places alike. Make not a city feast of it, to let

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: the meat cool ere we can agree upon the first place:

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: sit, sit. The gods require our thanks.

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: You great benefactors, sprinkle our society with

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: thankfulness. For your own gifts, make yourselves

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: praised: but reserve still to give, lest your

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: deities be despised. Lend to each man enough, that

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: one need not lend to another; for, were your

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: godheads to borrow of men, men would forsake the

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: gods. Make the meat be beloved more than the man

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: that gives it. Let no assembly of twenty be without

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: a score of villains: if there sit twelve women at

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: the table, let a dozen of them be--as they are. The

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: rest of your fees, O gods--the senators of Athens,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: together with the common lag of people--what is

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: amiss in them, you gods, make suitable for

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: destruction. For these my present friends, as they

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: are to me nothing, so in nothing bless them, and to

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: nothing are they welcome.

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Uncover, dogs, and lap.

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: The dishes are uncovered and seen to be full of warm water

speaker: Some Speak
text_entry: What does his lordship mean?

speaker: Some Others
text_entry: I know not.

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: May you a better feast never behold,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: You knot of mouth-friends I smoke and lukewarm water

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Is your perfection. This is Timon's last;

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Who, stuck and spangled with your flatteries,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Washes it off, and sprinkles in your faces

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Your reeking villany.

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Throwing the water in their faces

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Live loathed and long,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Most smiling, smooth, detested parasites,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Courteous destroyers, affable wolves, meek bears,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: You fools of fortune, trencher-friends, time's flies,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Cap and knee slaves, vapours, and minute-jacks!

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Of man and beast the infinite malady

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Crust you quite o'er! What, dost thou go?

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Soft! take thy physic first--thou too--and thou;--

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Stay, I will lend thee money, borrow none.

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Throws the dishes at them, and drives them out

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: What, all in motion? Henceforth be no feast,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Whereat a villain's not a welcome guest.

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Burn, house! sink, Athens! henceforth hated be

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Of Timon man and all humanity!

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Exit

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Re-enter the Lords, Senators,  and c

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: How now, my lords!

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Know you the quality of Lord Timon's fury?

speaker: Third Lord
text_entry: Push! did you see my cap?

speaker: Fourth Lord
text_entry: I have lost my gown.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: He's but a mad lord, and nought but humour sways him.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: He gave me a jewel th' other day, and now he has

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: beat it out of my hat: did you see my jewel?

speaker: Third Lord
text_entry: Did you see my cap?

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Here 'tis.

speaker: Fourth Lord
text_entry: Here lies my gown.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Let's make no stay.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Lord Timon's mad.

speaker: Third Lord
text_entry: I feel 't upon my bones.

speaker: Fourth Lord
text_entry: One day he gives us diamonds, next day stones.

speaker: Fourth Lord
text_entry: Exeunt
